meta.title: New York State Government
meta.description: High-level structure of New York State government as defined by the State Constitution.

nodes.label: NY State Constitution
nodes.factoid: Governing document outlining the structure and powers of New York State's government.

nodes.label: Governor of New York
nodes.factoid: The elected chief executive who proposes the state budget and oversees statewide agencies.

nodes.label: NY State Legislature
nodes.factoid: Bicameral legislature made up of the Assembly and Senate. Crafts state laws and adopts the budget.

nodes.label: State Agencies
nodes.factoid: Departments that implement state policy across transportation, health, education, and more.

nodes.label: State Budget
nodes.factoid: Annual fiscal plan that allocates funding to statewide priorities and agencies.
